article_text:
Cable-subscriber declines due to cord-cutting are Wall Street’s worry du jour when it comes to media companies. But well before that, there was the concern over TV advertising. And there was Viacom.

The company posted a 9% drop in domestic advertising revenue for its fiscal third quarter on Thursday. That was far worse than the already bleak 5.5% slide analysts had been forecasting. This prompted a massive selloff, making Viacom the...

twitter.description: Viacom’s low ratings and advertising-revenue slump are reasons for concern. But investors may be overreacting.
twitter.creator: @miriamgottfried
twitter.title: Viacom Panic Doesn’t Add Up

article_metadata.article.headline: Viacom panic doesn’t add up

article_summary:
Cable-subscriber declines due to cord-cutting are Wall Street’s worry du jour when it comes to media companies.
But well before that, there was the concern over TV advertising.
This prompted a massive selloff, making Viacom the...
The company posted a 9% drop in domestic advertising revenue for its fiscal third quarter on Thursday.
That was far worse than the already bleak 5.5% slide analysts had been forecasting.
